meanings.definition: A unit of currency in South Korea.
meanings.sent1: In South Korea, you can buy many things with one hwan.
meanings.sent2: The price of the item is 10 hwan.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally paid with a hwan instead of a won!
meanings.sent4: Her savings felt like a stack of hwan, ready to be spent.
meanings.sent5: The shiny hwan glinted in the sunlight, a symbol of wealth.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in North Korea.
meanings.sent1: The market only accepts hwan in North Korea.
meanings.sent2: He exchanged his dollars for North Korean hwan.
meanings.sent3: I dreamt of swimming in a pool of hwan coins!
meanings.sent4: The value of the hwan fluctuates with the political climate.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hwan clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Vietnam.
meanings.sent1: The street vendor quoted the price in hwan.
meanings.sent2: She exchanged her dong for Vietnamese hwan.
meanings.sent3: I found a lucky hwan on the sidewalk!
meanings.sent4: The hwan notes were beautifully decorated with traditional motifs.
meanings.sent5: The hwan felt light in his pocket, yet held so much value.
